version_description:
Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.
* We fixed a bug, so your PR badges will display in metric if your preferences are set to metric units.
* We've given you more control over the social sharing flow so you can choose to share a photo, map, or Image with stat overlays. The overlays will also show in camera mode so you can take the perfect picture.
Loving your Runkeeper experience? Please leave us a review!
We've added a social overlay to our sharing experience to celebrate the Global 5K! Be sure to share your activities with #RKGlobal5K
我们已添加社交叠加功能至共享体验，以庆祝全球 5 公里赛跑！请确保通过 #RKGlobal5K 共享你的活动。

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.
We've added some suggested workouts to the start screen to help provide guidance for new runners.
We updated the Apple Watch so it is fully compatible and syncs with the training plans in the app. The watch will also provide haptic feedback for your intervals.
Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day. This time, we made some bug fixes to make your Runkeeper experience even better.

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day. This time, we made some bug fixes to make your Runkeeper experience even better.

Watch users - the Apple Watch experience only provides haptic feedback for mi/km splits, support for intervals is on the way. Apologies for the confusion.
Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day. This time, we made some bug fixes to make your Runkeeper experience even better.

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day. This time, we made some bug fixes to make your Runkeeper experience even better.

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.
- Your total distance has moved into the 'Me' tab header so you can easily see how far you’ve run
- There’s a new stats section to easily see weekly, monthly or yearly progress
- We moved goals into the 'Me' tab so you can see all of your personal progress in one place
- Performance updates when launching the app so you can start tracking faster

就像您的健身过程一样，我们每天都在改进。
- 我们已提供用于 Fitbit 活动同步的技术性支持。在应用中进行连接，使 Fitbit 中追踪的活动与 Runkeeper 账户自动同步。
- Runkeeper现在与新的iPhone X和iOS 11版本兼容。

苹果手表用户, 感谢您对您正在经历的问题的反馈。我们正在努力解决这些问题，以确保您在运行时拥有丰富的经验。我们将很快发布这些补丁的更新。

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.
- We've added support for Fitbit activity syncing. Connect in the app to have your activities tracked on your Fitbit sync automatically to your Runkeeper account.
- Runkeeper is now compatible with the new iPhone X and iOS 11 release.
- We've also fixed a bug with connecting your heart rate monitors on iOS 11.

Apple Watch users, thank you for your feedback on the issues you are experiencing. We are working hard on fixing these problems to ensure you have a great experience when running. We will be releasing an update with these fixes very quickly.

We've updated our app icon! We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive community to help us in our effort to get the whole world running. This change is a result of months of testing to discover how to make the Runkeeper app more recognizable so we can help more runners reach their goals.

Apple Watch users, we are wrapping up a new release of Runkeeper for the Apple Watch that we will include in our next version. We have heard your feedback and improved the activity tracking, syncing experience, as well as added in some top requested features. Thank you so much for your continued patience with us as we work on getting this experience out for you.

We've updated our app icon! This change is a result of months of testing to discover how to make the Runkeeper app more recognizable so we can help more runners reach their goals.

Apple Watch users, we are wrapping up a new release of Runkeeper for the Apple Watch that we will include in our next version. We have heard your feedback and improved the activity tracking, syncing experience, as well as added in some top requested features. Thank you so much for your continued patience with us as we work on getting this experience out for you.

Guess what! We redesigned and rebuilt the Apple Watch app. We squashed some tricky GPS bugs, greatly improving the reliability of Watch trips. We’ve listened to our users (hey that’s you!) and we think you’re really going to like this update.

New
- Dedicated heart rate screen to show zones <3
- Splits alert with quick comparison
- Post activity stat summary
- Recent run history for Watch runs
- Use your Watch as a remote when tracking with your iPhone

Improved
- GPS performance and reliability
- More glanceable stats, easier to read while running
- Simplified settings with countdown option
- Better Watch only mode—start a run from your iPhone or Watch

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.

New
- Average pace now available as an option on the Watch

Improved
- Fixed some app crash issues associated with Apple Watch
- Updated default language preferences for your convenience

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.

New
- Average pace now available as an option on the Watch

Improved
- Fixed some app crash issues associated with Apple Watch
- Updated default language preferences for your convenience

Improved
- Fixed some app crash issues associated with Friends Feed

Improved
- Fixed some app crash issues associated with Friends Feed

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.

- Fixed an issue where Runkeeper Go users still saw sponsored promotions. To turn promotions off go to Me > Settings > Account Settings and disable the “Display Promotions” toggle.
- Fixed an issue that was causing specific Challenges to display incorrect stats and information.

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.

- Fixed an issue where Runkeeper Go users still saw sponsored promotions. To turn promotions off go to Me > Settings > Account Settings and disable the “Display Promotions” toggle.
- Fixed an issue that was causing specific Challenges to display incorrect stats and information.
Bug fixes and improvements
Bug fixes and improvements
New release, new logo… same Runkeeper app. Update now so we can get back to that run.
Bug fixes and improvements

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.
• Fixed a couple of bugs that were preventing "My First 5K" users from unlocking their next workout, and hearing the audio coaching.
• Having trouble sharing to Facebook? It's on our radar, and will be fixed in the next Runkeeper release. Thanks for your patience!

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day!

We updated our half marathon plans with interval workouts and better paces! We haven’t added intervals to our other race plans just yet, but we have made the paces for these plans a bit faster, too. And don’t worry, intervals are coming for all race distances soon!

We also updated our Pace Academy challenge with new designs and a new slogan—Win The Long Run. We’ve made these updates to show you that we want to support you in a lifetime journey of running, one workout at a time.

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day!

●Users enrolled in a Running for Exercise program: we know a number of you have been experiencing an issue with your workouts disappearing. This release includes a fix for that issue so that going forward you will always see your full week of workouts!

Apple Watch Users: We rolled back some Apple Watch changes that were causing crashes and app instability. We're very sorry about that and are actively working on more fixes that will be available soon.

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.
NEW: Having someone keep tabs on you during your runs is important! So we built a new Live Tracking feature that allows your friends to track you and cheer you on while you run
NEW: Speaking of friends, we redesigned the friends feed so you can stay engaged with your favorite running buddies
Unfortunately, Facebook made some updates that prevent us from auto-sharing so we had to remove that feature
Bug fixes and improvements

NEW: *Drumroll…* An exciting new audio-guided training plan called My First 5K. In this plan ASICS Frontrunner Coach Erin guides you every step of the way, encouraging you toward your goal of running—you guessed it—your first 5K!

NEW: A updated training tab allows you to access all running and cross training plans in one location so that you can find your perfect plan, faster!

Unfortunately, we are no longer able to offer a connection to Twitter or support the Pebble watch.

As always, we’ve included a few bug fixes and improvements!

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.
NEW: *Drumroll…* An exciting new audio-guided training plan called My First 5K. In this plan ASICS Frontrunner Coach Erin guides you every step of the way, encouraging you toward your goal of running—you guessed it—your first 5K!

NEW: A updated training tab allows you to access all running and cross training plans in one location so that you can find your perfect plan, faster!

Unfortunately, we are no longer able to offer a connection to Twitter or support the Pebble watch.

As always, we’ve included a few bug fixes and improvements!

Apple Watch Users: We are working on improving our Apple Watch experience and will be releasing those improvements in our 9.5 release.

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day.
● Apple Watch Users: We know that you’ve been telling us about issues with your watches, and we’re sorry that we weren’t able to fix them immediately. We want you to have a great experience! We’re happy to announce that we’ve implemented two major fixes in this release: one to reduce crashes and one to improve syncing. We’ve also included updated App sizes for Series 4 watches! We will continue to work on improving our Apple Watch experience and will release more improvements soon!

● NEW: We’ve introduced OneASICS, a single sign on experience, to Runkeeper! This will allow you to use your Runkeeper login ID for all ASICS accounts you use!

● As always, we have also included bug fixes to improve iPhone performance

● As always, we have also included bug fixes to improve iPhone performance

We also updated our Pace Academy challenge with new designs and a new slogan—Win The Long Run. We’ve made these updates to show you that we want to support you in a lifetime journey of running, one workout at a time.

We updated all of our personalized race plans with interval workouts and improved paces to help you reach your racing goals! You can access all of our plans on the Training tab with a Runkeeper Go subscription!

Unfortunately, we are no longer able to provide support for iOS 11.1 and lower. There will be no more updates to Runkeeper for any OS version below 11.2.

As always, we’ve included a few bug fixes and improvements!

In this release we’ve fixed an elevation stats bug so that your elevation is always accurately reported on the Me Tab!

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving everyday! As of this release, default activity and map privacy settings can now be found under the new "Privacy" menu in your Runkeeper settings. As always, we’ve also included some bug fixes to improve your experience!

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day. This time, we made some bug fixes to make your Runkeeper experience even better.
We fixed some crashes that cropped up with iOS13. Please be sure to update to this version for the best experience!
We fixed some crashes that cropped up with iOS13. Please be sure to update to this version for the best experience!
In this version we’ve resolved some crashes specific to iOS 13.

You can now manage your email communication preferences in the app! This new “Email Notifications” page is located in your Runkeeper Settings.

We’ve also added a new feature for runners in race training plans. Now, if you miss too much time to safely jump back into your plan as scheduled, we’ll offer you the option to adjust your workouts to help you get back on track and reach your goals!

Apple watch users, we’ve also included some bug fixes to reduce crashes you may be experiencing and make sure your cadence is correctly tracked!

In this release we fixed a bug that was causing inaccurate split times for workouts with warmups and cool-downs. (That’s pretty cool if you ask us!) To our Apple Watch users: You’ll now see elevation data recorded on your trips tracked with a Series 3 or later Watch.
You won't see anything new here, but we've made some minor stability improvements.

APPLE WATCH USERS: in this release, we’ve added audio cues for free runs! This means you can now hear audio cues for starting, stopping, and pausing your activity, as well as key stat updates (like your average pace), without bringing your phone along!

NEW: You can now choose whether to receive notifications when your friends complete activities in the app under Settings > Push Notifications. With these notifications, you can track your friends’ progress and congratulate them when they finish a workout!

Happy Running!

GARMIN USERS: We’ve added a feature that allows you to sync your Runkeeper race training plan with your Garmin! This means that you now have the option to select and follow your training plan workouts directly from your watch. When you do this, your training plan workouts will automatically be associated with your Runkeeper training plan.

APPLE WATCH USERS: In an effort to simplify the watch experience, we're decoupling the phone experience from the watch. This means that when you want to track an activity on your watch, you’ll need to start and stop it from your watch - but it also means you can leave your phone at home! And don’t worry, once you save your watch trip it will sync to your phone.

SHOE TRACKER USERS: In this release we’ve fixed a bug so that you can see all the latest shoe options we add to our list without logging out and logging back in.

Happy Running!

Starting with this release, you can now choose to receive or disable push notifications for motivation and challenges. This gives you more control over your notifications, so that you can choose to see the push notifications that are most motivating to you! This release also includes fixes for several major bugs that some of you have been experiencing, including duplicate trips showing up in your activity history, extra distance showing in your stats on the Me tab, and updated weight entries not saving.

APPLE WATCH USERS: In this release, we’ve added additional audio cues to the watch! You can now hear audio cues for custom workouts, race training plans, and running for exercise plans. We’ve also made changes to improve trip syncing, and to allow you to stream heart rate from your watch to your phone while you’re running with your watch but carrying your phone.

Important update for users who log in with Facebook: If you use your Facebook account to log in to the Runkeeper app, you must update to this version, 10.5, to continue to be able to log in. Due to some necessary maintenance work with our integration with Facebook, login with Facebook on previous app versions will not work. There’s no change to the login process, and no changes to Facebook permissions or privacy--this was just behind-the-scenes code maintenance!
Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day. This time, we made some bug fixes to make your Runkeeper experience even better. Stay strong Runkeeper family!

We improved the search functionality so, now it’s easier than ever to connect with your friends on Runkeeper™!

APPLE WATCH USERS: We heard your feedback, and are happy to report that in this release we have reinstated the apple watch remote feature! You can now start a trip on your phone and view trip stats on your watch while you run. You can also pause, start, and end your trip on the watch.

We improved the search functionality so, now it’s easier than ever to connect with your friends on Runkeeper™!

APPLE WATCH USERS: We heard your feedback, and are happy to report that in this release we have reinstated the Apple Watch remote feature! You can now start a trip on your phone and view trip stats on your watch while you run. You can also pause, start, and end your trip on the watch.

We’ve been working with Race Roster, the newest addition to the ASICS family, to bring you virtual events! Just go to raceroster.com to register for your events, check your official confirmation email and get ready to run! Select and run your race with Runkeeper, then keep an eye on the leaderboard as we submit your results back to Race Roster!

If you haven't registered for an event yet, now's the time! Head on over to raceroster.com to discover a virtual event in your area!

Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day. This time, we made some bug fixes to make your Runkeeper experience even better.

In this version, you can now opt in/out of notifications for Likes and Comments in the Push Notifications settings page of the app. We’ve also improved the Virtual Race experience to make competing in your race easier and more enjoyable than ever! Virtual Race activities are now easily distinguishable from your other activities so that you can find and celebrate your race whenever you want. If you haven't registered for a virtual race yet, now's the time! Head on over to raceroster.com to discover a virtual event in your area.
You’ll notice in this version that the Start screen header has gotten a little “refresh.” We’ve also done some of our usual maintenance to keep the app performant!
Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day. This time, we made some bug fixes to make your Runkeeper experience even better.

In this version, we’ve renamed the “Challenges” tab as the “Explore” tab. Why? So that you can discover, register and manage all things virtual races and challenges in one tab! Also new in the Races section of the “Explore” tab: You can register for the upcoming ASICS World Ekiden 2020 event!

In this version, we’ve renamed the “Challenges” tab as the “Explore” tab. Why? So that you can discover, register and manage all things virtual races and challenges in one tab! Also new in the Races section of the “Explore” tab: You can register for the upcoming ASICS World Ekiden 2020 event!

In this version, we’ve renamed the “Challenges” tab as the “Explore” tab. Why? So that you can discover, register and manage all things virtual races and challenges in one tab! Also new in the Races section of the “Explore” tab: You can register for the upcoming ASICS World Ekiden 2020 event!

In this version, we’ve renamed the “Challenges” tab as the “Explore” tab. Why? So that you can discover, register and manage all things virtual races and challenges in one tab! Also new in the Races section of the “Explore” tab: You can register for the upcoming ASICS World Ekiden 2020 event!

This version includes some work to support iOS 14. We also fixed a couple of bugs: one issue with the Goal Insights summary text overlapping its graph, and one issue with the text on social share graphics being small and off-center. We know these issues were annoying and we’re just as happy as you are that they’re resolved!

In this version, we’ve added Race Mode audio cues to virtual races. You’ll now be able to enjoy race-specific audio cues that are both motivating and educational about the event you’re running in. We’ve also made it easier to select from a list of multiple teams and segments if you’ve registered for the same virtual relay race more than once.

In this version, we’ve added Race Mode audio cues to virtual races. You’ll now be able to enjoy race-specific audio cues that are both motivating and educational about the event you’re running in. We’ve also made it easier to select from a list of multiple teams and segments if you’ve registered for the same virtual relay race more than once.

We’re continuing to improve the virtual race experience: now, you can see your virtual race results right after you finish your activity. In other news, we’ve fixed a couple of small issues with notes and “likes” on the activity summary screen and resolved some top crashes.
Happy Holidays from the Runkeeper team!
In this version, we fixed a bug causing some users’ profile photos not to show up, resolved some crashes, and updated the design of activity tags.
In this version, we fixed a bug causing some users’ profile photos not to show up, resolved some crashes, and updated the design of activity tags.
Just like your fitness journey, we’re improving every day. This time, we made some bug fixes to make your Runkeeper experience even better.
You can now see a list of your top running achievements for elevation gain and longest activity by clicking on those badges in the Achievements screen. Now go try for a PR!
